Title: SMARTD Web-Based Monitoring and Evaluation System
Source title: 1st 2018 Indonesian Association for Pattern Recognition International Conference, INAPR 2018 - Proceedings

Abstract: Sustainable Management of Agricultural Research and Technology Dissemination (SMARTD) is a national program organized by Indonesian Agency for Agricultural Research and Development (IAARD), The Ministry of Agriculture of the Republic of Indonesia. It provides funding to increase research capacity in all units under IAARD. Because of the large scope of this program, a good monitoring and evaluation system is needed to ensure its effectiveness. A web-based application is proposed to complement the existing manual monitoring system. Design Thinking method and SCRUM are used as the approach to develop system. This system was developed using PHP 5 with Code Igniter framework and the database was developed using MySQL. This system has successfully implemented to all units under IAARD and are running smoothly for daily reporting system. © 2018 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Evaluation; Information System; Monitoring; Reporting System; Web Application
Index Keywords: Agriculture; Information systems; Pattern recognition; Research and development management; Websites; Agricultural research; Daily reporting system; Evaluation; Monitoring and evaluations; Reporting systems; Sustainable management; WEB application; Web-based applications; Monitoring
Funding Text 1: I. INTRODUCTION SMARTD is one of important programs from the Ministry of Agriculture of the Republic of Indonesia in order to increase the resource capacity within the Indonesian Agency for Agricultural Research and Development (IAARD) for the period of 2012 – 2018. This project’s scopes include funded project for human resources development, research infrastructure development and research collaboration. SMARTD activities are mainly funded through the World Bank's long-term loan and the Indonesian Government budget as a matching fund.
Funding Text 2: ACKNOWLEDGMENT This project is mainly funded by IAARD, Ministry of Agriculture of Republic of Indonesia. All system development processes were done using Bioinformatics and Data Science Research Center (BDSRC) facility, at the University of Bina Nusantara.

Authors: Lie Y., Atmojo R.N.P., Muljo H.H., Purnamasari S., Pardamean B.
Title: A comparison of customer preference towards two different types of e-Tailing channel
Source title: Proceedings of 2017 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2017
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Accounting Information Systems Program, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Lie, Y., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Atmojo, R.N.P., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Muljo, H.H., Accounting Information Systems Program, Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Purnamasari, S., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Pardamean, B., Computer Science Department, BINUS Graduate Program - Master of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: This research aims to compare the sales and visitor access between online Buy/Sale/Trade (BST) forum and e-Marketplace. The research problem is effectiveness of community-based e-commerce transaction in facing e-marketplace trend on small and medium enterprise (SME) of online car accessories sales. Objective of the comparison is to determine which is the best customer preference towards promotion and sales about car accessories products in Small and Medium Enterprise (SME)'s in Indonesian e-Tailing market. This research used quantitative method T-test data analysis and the correlation methods to measure visitor access and sale frequency as well as analysis of the consumer data in BST forum and the e-Marketplace as a complement. The analysis showed that visitor access traffic and sales frequency in e-Marketplace is significantly higher than the BST's forum. Thus, we are highly recommend that every single SMEs retailer should promote their products on e-Marketplace channel aggressively. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Buy/Sale/Trade Forum; e-Marketplace; Online Transaction; Small Medium Enterprise (SME)
Index Keywords: Commerce; Correlation methods; Information management; Buy/Sale/Trade Forum; Customer preferences; E-commerce transactions; E-marketplaces; Online transaction; Quantitative method; Small and medium enterprise; Small medium enterprise; Sales
